alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 6:26PM EDT until May 16 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WAYNE...SOUTHWESTERN NASH...WILSON AND NORTHEASTERN JOHNSTON COUNTIES... At 626 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bailey, or 17 miles northeast of Smithfield, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Wilson, Fremont, Bailey, Kenly, Lucama, Middlesex, Stantonsburg, Black Creek, Pikeville and Saratoga. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Raleigh.
